honestly i got a membership to aaa in february thinking i had a big road trip in april now my car is sitting in the driveway like a lawn ornament
aaas business model

used to work for them they dont make money off the membership they make thier money off thier other services used to see how much they pay towing companies and boy is it more than what you pay for memebership
yep if you can afford the primer membership its a damn good deal for the ridiculous range of the tows included
if you have an older piece of shit vehicle and want to drive it til it dies aaa is worth every penny
one time i killed my battery sitting in my car during my lunch break about a half hour and 50 later i had a new battery thanks aaa

i have had aaa since i turned 16 i dont even think about whether to renew it each june 

theyll give you gasi once parked on a hill in sf so steep that my gas gauge read empty didnt realize this until they filled me up enough to start my car and i drove away with 14 tank unlock your cari kept a spare house key hidden in my car so i never had to pay my landlords lockout fee tow you when you get a flatchanging a tire on the side of the road in 110 degree weather isnt worth it 1110 would recommend
lpt be sure to keep the battery charged some batteries dont like going totally flat

but seriously im driving around the neighborhood at least once a week to keep it charged
my gym isnt charging during the pandemic that and theyre closed too
samesies

my gym was closed for two weeks and after that i got an email asking how to handle the payments they received there were a choice of deducting it from the next fee or to not claim it at all i thought about all the people that would probably get affected by this in the long run and opted to not ask for anything back now it opened again after those two weeks but theyre probably taking quite a hit economically and im just hoping they can keep all the employees im not going there but still paying since i also care about not being part of spreading corona if i can avoid it
you saw me a good person way to go you

thanks i think most of us try to contribute and help as much as we can different people different needs and opportunities and while i can afford this some unfortunately cant    
stay safe

mine closed and stopped charging then started sending out free home workout content to all members so im actually better off than if i hadnt signed up in the first place

everyday five times a week

definitely agree there i live in a very small community see the gym owners in the village all the time kind of small i know they will probably put our memberships on hold for a few months but even if they dont im not that stressed about it they have done such an awesome job with it since they bought it open 24 hours new equipment lots of classes

ha same finally found a gym i feel really comfortable in well its not going anywhere hopefully so i will just start going again when its safe i had to get swabbed today for covid as i have a sore throat and a cough so its at least 3 days of isolation for me till the test comes back neither dr i talked to thinks its it though no cases near us at all but better safe than sorry still common sense doesnt seem so common these days so i will hibernate as long as i can hello from bc canada stay safe over there
good luck im in victoria hope you are well
hello fellow islander thank you stay safe out there

hope its not covid or atleast that it wont give you or others close to you a difficult time wish you all the best and a quick recovery

thank you that means a lot im more worried for my community right now so all available appendages crossed its just an annoying spring cold
same

paid the year up front for both my gyms one was like were closed until further notice no refunds sucks to suck the other sends biweekly emails on updates to the potential reopening as well as equipment being upgraded and stated that for every week of closure i can choose between receiving personal training sessions guest passes or a prorated discount on my next renewal no points for guessing which ones getting canceled when this is all over
yeah no kidding its funny how this whole situation either brings out the good or the bad makes it real easy to know who to support in the long run stay safe out there

my dating life
oof this hits too hard
same i broke up with my gf and my best friend is with her now so i was like okey i will try to make new friends and was literally in the process of organizing a meeting with a few when this happened

unless you have like siriusxm only in your car
most siriusxm subscriptions come with the app now  i listen on my phone all day
i hate them got a new car that came with it and i didnt know until my free trial was almost up and they kept calling and emailing me to pay lol no thanks i got spotify
perfect year for grocery store and amazon profit
its really a bad year to do anything in general
except build a homegym

i had just gotten into such a great routine was getting up early and going to the gym 5 days a week for the last year or so i had been on and off and really inconsistent but i had finally worked out a schedule and stuck to it for a solid month in february i even started to look forward to the gym fuck you rona
more like its a bad year to be a gym can always work out at home

lets be honest here body weight exercises are not as good as the usual lifts and most people dont have the space  money to buy a home gym im happy with a couple dumbbells and cycling season for cardio though

i used to only do bodyweight workouts at home for years and liked it but struggled to progress then starting lifting at the gym and was doing great for 6 months now my gym is closed and going back to bodyweight sucks i do it but it feels like a chore where lifting used to be fun

have you figured out what made it better at the gym maybe you can modify things at home to better reflect that 

like if it was the comradeship of other people maybe you could do workouts with others over video if it was the motivational music see if you can find something similar online like spotify or pandora

i havent figured it out 

im not very social at the gym and i listen to the same music at home so i dont think its that 

i honestly just feel different after a workout like because im still a novice i was adding 5 lbs to all my lifts pretty consistently and starting to put up some relatively heavy stuff the rush is different for me with bodyweight stuff maybe i should set a lofty goal of doing a handstand pushup or something i can work towards i guess

if that doesnt work ill probably just conclude that i like a different type of workout and try to save for a power rack

goals can definitely make a difference 

hope you keep at it and find a way to persevere
thanks

good points though i will say my husband is getting a more vigorous workout doing jump rope and body weight exercises than he was getting at the gym only investment so far has been a pipe so he can do pullups
yup a lot of independent gyms are going to fucking die over this
i know a guy who just opened a gym a few weeks ago lol rented space bought equipment now hes asking on facebook for advice on how to get business loans no idea what hes thinking
smh not sure he was thinking to try opening a gym right now
some gyms will refund
all the gyms in my area have paused their memberships so if you had 5 months left when they closed youll have 5 months when they reopen
there are better years yes but my gym still takes the monthly paycheck and offers free months in return
honestly by midfebruary most of the resolutioners have quit going anyway

my gym charged me for april and when i emailed i got nothing after 3 weeks obviously they are closed i ended up calling and disputing the charges youfit was nice while it lasted but when this reopens i am finding a new gym to join they pissed me off so much since my friends who belong to other gyms got emails saying their memberships were on hold immediately when the lockdown went into effect and wont have their half of the month they lost in march held against them and will get a credit on their account i cant wait to hear from them saying they cant charge me for some strange reason

o yes and i also have tennis club membership yoga and museum card well spend money
i got a kickboxing membership now i feel my fat growing by the second

i joined one at the start of february was going 45 times a week and was actually feeling better and starting to see little physical difference got the notice 315 they were shutting down so i got weights and stuff for the garage problem is thats where the beer and weed is too so my workouts seem get interrupted

you dont have problems with putting fresh manure in your garden ive always had a manure pile i turn so it wont burn the plants how far out from planting are yall

we have a massive garden space and we till deep so its diluted enough that its fine its also mixed with bedding material like straw and is from our over winter deep bedding so its been composting in the barn since november the warmth of the bedding composting actually works to keep our animals warmer we will be planting wednesday
what ratio fresh to winterized do you use
according to my fitbit a couple hours working in the garden burned more calories than what i typically burn in an hour in the gym
holy fuck its the next morning and my arms are screaming still more to do today someone pray to the homesteading gods for strength for me as i have a date with the fence post pounder
hard to say the deep bedding is about 6 deep and i would say the top inch or two i would call fresh and the remaining i would call overwintered

seconded whenever someone brings up the gym i just mention that i   insert homestead activity here ex tilled my garden turned the compost pile weeded my garden etc yesterday used a mattock to take out all my aggression on the burdock taking over my pasture in the rain for 2 hours  who needs pilates when you have a pickaxe
damn right who needs a gym membership when we live this life
plus not only did you burn calories but you get to look at what you have accomplished certainly some days are more satisfying than others but still

yeah they dont actually want you there  the best gym member is the one that paysautopsy never cancels and never once works out
yip like insurance

there is an app where you can bet against them for how much weight you will lose apparently the app developers are still making money when people are putting money against their own goals so it doesnt seem to motivate everyone enough
interesting there are some companies also that have started offering incentives around staying healthy

that is because the developer keeps a portion of all bets made it is a big rip off they keep like 20 so even if you win you dont get the payoff if you had made bets with people in real life the app takes a cut and then if others win the same as you then yall split the money you could end up losing money despite winning your bet
interesting i never really looked into it because having the added pressure of losing money while not meeting my goal sounded depressing only 4lbs from my goal weight now and havent lost a cent
thats actually a really good idea bot idk if a gym would accept to do that because they would lose money
no they wouldnt they would gain more business and people would still fail to lose weight like they always do
true you can count on the normal population distribution of any metric of human behavior

some gyms do this type of thing  i worked at a gym once that had a dollars for lbs fat off deal  for every lb you lost during this competition the gym paid you   you had to pay to enter but plenty of people made their money back  the gym ended up losing a bit of money on the deal but the advertising it earned them paid it back in spades

in the netherlands there is gym franchise called trainmore en you get 1 back for every time you visit the gym for at least 30 minutes though there are some exceptions im not sure if it motivates people but i believe the gym is rather succesful or at least it was until corona hit
the en told me youre definitely dutch but imo the government should subsidize gyms like this though it should be based on i not weight
not everyone goes to the gym to lose weight
would probably be cheaper to do this than pay for healthcare
no shit
make it so the treadmills keep the lights on

anytime fitness where i live requires that you sign an 18month contract to get the cheap membership price otherwise you pay twice as much to go monthtomonth yeahnot happening i bought my own equipment and worked out in my basement and now that the gym is closed from the pandemic i feel like a moneysaving genius
they bank on people buying memberships at the start of the year and never showing up free money

i have a small gym setup at home bench dumbbells spin bike chindip station but while it gets the job done i look forward to getting back to the gym  

its not that i socialize or talk to people or anything but sometimes i like being around people who are exercising when im working out and they also have some equipment for moves i cant emulate at home heavy deadlifts for example itll be nice getting back
it motivated me seeing positive energy
agreed

other important part is watching people do weird exercises and then googling to see why ive added some dope exercises that work better for correct muscle activation because i saw someone doing something weirddifferent

i think a hybrid of both free weights and bodyweight workouts are optimal this is just my personal preference though i am a member of a luxurious gym that has a lot of amenities i really enjoy so i intend to keep my membership although i do not pay for my membership so i am obviously in a unique situation
if i quit i would really miss the sauna
literally the reason why i havent quit the gym i look forward to is so much after my workout its an integral part
the sauna is always my post workout reward
lol me too its honestly the only reason i can motivate myself to go to the gym i just think about how good it feels to sit in there after and it drives me to go
exactly same here
bought an infrared sauna for the home through costco a while back and it was so worth it  its not quite the same as a regular dry sauna but it hits the spot

my training mostly involves bodybuilding with lots of heavy compound movements switching to a home gym with some adjustable dumbbells and just a bench has been a fun experience ive stuck with low rest periods myoreps bfr etc

now i dont think there are many good substitutes for certain movements like  bench press or squat but  im finding that this is really making me rethink my approach to training i normally spend about 810 hours physically in the gym each week for lifting now that i have some basic equipment once things go back to normal i may simply limit my time in the gym to compound lifts i cant do at home which would mean maybe being physically in the gym 23 hours a week and working out the rest of the time at home i think by sticking to a suboptimal training program for a lot of my accessory work i can get my exercise time down to 5 hours a week which would be amazing 

ampx200b

it may sound unusual to say i want to use a suboptimal program but im starting to realize that in my 30s i value my time a lot more than optimality and thats an important lesson im taking from this experience being at home due to covid
this is every gyms biggest nightmare

yeah i think gyms and hairdressers will see a reduction in the number of clients many of people have tried to cut their own hair at home and it has worked out nicely in addition people have less money available so saving the money that usually goes to the gym and hairdresser is a tempting option
i doubt they are cutting their own hair

i just dont like gyms bc of germs and i dont really care to be around people  so ive been adding to my garage gym over the past 3 years  its definitely the way to go  dont have to drive anywhere and the money i invested in the equipment gives me a little more motivation to get out there and use it

ditto all of this i maintain a small home gym in my unused second bedroom mostly unused if you count boxes from my last move i never unpacked its by far the best noncar money ive spent in the last few years i dont care for the whole process of going to the gym so this has been fantastic so much time and energy saved by having it at home

same as well i have a very small space but i have a rack and weights and its replaced the gym for me i know its not for everyone but it has enhanced my life so much just doing it at my home on my own schedule in my own space
i am fully convinced that i train more consistently bc of having home equipment

just bought my first house and i absolutely cannot wait to turn one of the bedrooms into a home gym gonna keep it simple at first just a rack bench and weights but im pumped to be able to workout at home

congrats on the house thats pretty much what i did started with the puzzle piece flooring a rack bench with preacher curl and leg developer bar  plates and a couple sets of dumbbells also picked up rings to hang on the rack for some extra fun last year i picked up dip bars and a wallmounted cable setup for space efficiency reasons and it was great apart from the assembly process

im a renter so i have no idea how this will all get broken down when the inevitable move happens but thats futuremes problem 

i would love to do a home gym in my garage but it is not attached and doesnt have proper climate control 

it would be absolutely freezing in the winter and a deadly sauna in the summer 

stupid chicago weather

is that something that can be solved with a space heater and standalone ac my gym is in my second bedroom so heating isnt so much an issue but it gets gnarly hot in summer thanks to the location of my ac and the poor airflowdesign of my apartment can definitely relate thereeven though putting in a vertical fan helped my summer workouts are definitely sweaty and dehydrating

i just dont know if having something like that would make a difference i mean i could look into doing something proper but i dont think it would be worth that kind of money 

a space heater when it is 10f with no real insulation in the garage would probably not cut it 

and you know i dont need another reason not to go haha

haha yeah thats a great point im in new england but sometimes forget how much of a frozen hellscape chicago becomes in the winter while theres probably a heater out there for the job the cost  the cost of running it  insulating the floor etc would be a real investment im sure

not knocking it at all but you can insulate the garage for a couple hundred pretty easy and a decent space heater on a smart switch or two are cheap  window hvac is a hundred  

i say this having just done it   i didnt do it for a gym but to work on other shit  but its doable i just prefer the gym myself  just food for thought
i would definitely be interested in attempted it where do you live
dc  less winter but way hotter summer

gt anyone else having a similar experience 

not here i miss the shit out of it cant do pullups because the parks are closed besides that i have a few bands and a 15lb kettlebell im in a 400 sqft studio there is barely room to even do bodyweight stuff in here its also where i cook sleep shower eat and work at the moment i want my heavy weight back plus i enjoy the atmosphere and going to a place were the only focus is exerciselifting is part of the motivation for me its my church my little mental break from all the stress in my life 

that said there were days where i just didnt feel like dealing with the crowd so i am going to work on getting my own equipment essentials and possibly renting a storage unit to use as my alternatebackup gym

this  i mostly do functional fitness stuff usually a class 3  5 days and train myself on the alternates and i really miss it because it was my time out from the world 

ive always been fun training at home running doing nike training clubs or using a wod generator if i want to do a bit of crossfit style stuff but the gym is my control i go before work and its the time when i can say i didnt just wake up to work plus i just really enjoy the classes

its like a playground for adults plus you get to wear coolfunky clothes and shoes with space age materials and crazy colors that are generally not acceptable in other situations it makes you feel like a athleteninjasuperhero not to mention ive been going to the same gym 36x a week for like 4 years so i pretty much know everyone there
just before lockdown i bought a bench and some dumbbells  now they reside in my kitchen and every day after work i do 10 sets of something  already gaining
you can do quite a bit with a dumbbell and a jump rope in addition to a multitude of bodyweight movements that can be scaled to varying degrees of difficulty

same i am currently spending 200 a month for 3 x per week barrys bootcamp classes
prior to starting barrys i was a member of a 103 a month gym plus was doing extra gym classes elsewhere

i defs think when this is over i will be going running outside and investing in my own at home weights theyre sold out everywhere in the uk so relying in one kettlebell
and maybe just doing a once a week barrys as its amazing haha

fitness and health is very important to me i enjoy it alot and the classes are amazing but ive been really enjoying exercising outside so maybe for the summer at least ill keep it up
if your goal is strength youre going to need to handle some heavy weight with that said theres absolutely nothing wrong with bodyweight exercises just dont expect optimal strength and hypertrophy

i started dabbling in body weight fitness about 3 months ago and found it more enjoyable and sustainable than traditional weights this current situation hasnt really had an impact on my daily exercise
i love body weight stuff yoga hiit and once you get conditioned to regular body weight you can easily add in weights bit by bit and end up with a nice home gym

ive been working primarily in hiit and body weight for years mostly because i couldnt find a gym that fit my budget and schedule i finally found a gym that met both two weeks before the shut down

bodyweight and hiit is amazing especially for functional strength it should always be a component of your routine however gyms are also essential for strength building nothing will get you as strong and toned as challenging deadlifts and compound movements
body weight has been my best choice and im shredded im not affected by the lockdown im even helping people stay active with body weight

any time you do different exercises youre likely to work the muscles in ways they arent used to and inducing new kinds of soreness which is cool and a good thing to look at doing from a standpoint of keeping things fresh and interesting 

on that note i think thats also part of what has you excited to work out in general as humans we crave novelty to maintain our interest and excitement and workout routines are no different however i suspect that if you did your current hiitbodyweight stuff for a year straight youd start to feel stale with that as well

for me what the quarantine has made me rethink is simply the benefit of buying a power rack bench and free weights and getting my own home gym really up and running so i dont have to be dependent on an outside facility worry about germs waiting to use equipment etc

yep  ive been doing hiit workouts via the fiton app  a lot of the videos incorporate dumbbells of various weights  i enjoy these so much and i know that even when the gym opens back up i wont want to be out in public for long periods of time anyway  my membership is up in june i think  strongly considering cancelling my membership at this point
i pulled out the weight bench dumbbells and weight vest  coupling bw exercises with the vest and dbs has made me very happy  vests are definitely a big addition to home workouts
i agree ive been loving doing some of the live instagram workouts ive been doing the barrys canada workouts almost daily their trainers are amazing
once i get a rack and weights im definitely gonna cancel my membership yea i have less workout machines but save time and convenience at home
can i ask what hiit routine are you currently doing

i just went on youtube and did a quick search for a home hiit i tried a few but my favorite one so far is by a trainer named natacha oceane she does a really good job and mixing things up she also posts regularly so things dont get stale

i sort of miss the energy of the gym with people buzzing around and working out i also miss our group cycle class which helped keep me motivated an our instructor who had some great advice which would have helped me if with my upcoming rides  events 

being in another place let me forget about current issues and shift my frame of mind its much harder to do that

on the bright side i dont have an excuse not to work out at least 30 mins to an hour everyday i only have 3 kettlebells and a smart cycle trainer so i have to be creative but i still get a good workout in

its been that way long before this came along millions of people are gross look at the smaller scale of when you went to the gym you would see one or two people not wiping down the machine before or after magnify that now
single leg body weight squat is killing me
im too scared to even try
im not a fan of gyms when i do go i just act like no one else is there anyways i never use any of the amenities because honestly the people i see using them are disgusting

i had a gym membership for pilates and to swim as im mostly a runner i never had the selfdiscipline to work out at home the boyfriend and i are building a home gym in our workshop which should cover the little bit of weightlifting i do and once this is all over and my boyfriend goes back to work i can possibly see if my neighbor wants to come over to work out with me so we can both stay accountable ill save swimming for the springsummerfall when my triathlete buddies are doing open water swims in the river and do indoor rock climbing in the winter

thats a long way of saying that yes im considering dropping the gym

fitness is the practice of adapting to the physical demands placed on the body the majority of people do very little to change up their routine and thus they experience diminishing returns after all if you routine is always about the same what is there for the body to adapt to what we are experiencing now as a global community is a forced change to our fitness routine so i am not surprised you are having good results however the science shows that you will adapt to your new routine between 4 and 12 weeks of starting it

so although there is plenty of variation that can be introduced even with a home workout i wouldnt cancel my gym membership when you go back to weights youll have an even more effective workout than before
really a good point one of the pros to keeping the membership would be access to good equipment and variety

ive been working out in my home consistently for about 10 years now during this time i have added to my equipment as my interests grew and i looked for new ways to motivate myself the best thing about what is happening now from a fitness standpoint is that people are discovering new ways of working out changing their routine suddenly things like resistance bands body weight training jump ropes etc are found to be very challenging and beneficial i hope people remember this when things get back to normal i wouldnt think of ever going to a gym and always looking for some new equipment good luck to all of you i would add that i am fortunate to have a basement to do this so no disrespect to anyone that does not or just prefers the gym environment just remember that variety really can hold your interest in those times when we all need that extra push dont let this time go to waste
are you talking diminishing returns if you dont progressively overload or confusing the muscles

yes you must progressively overload the challenge of the lift but not necessarily the pure weight for example for op benching at x weight may be harder than a pushup but where he was doing sets of 8 on the bench he is now doing sets of 25 pushups or you can imagine someone benching at 185 to switching to db bench press at 85lbs each the db bench may be more challenging even though it is less weight

ok agreed to be fair though you can still progressively overload bodyweight with the upper body for a hell of a lot longer than that you can weight them for one or just vary the leverage to stay in your desired rep range from pike pushups to handstand pushups pseudo planche to planche pushups incline to decline rows and to one hand pullups gymnastic rings are several years worth of progressive overload by themselves its just harder to measure and overload incrementally

oh 100 agreed you can stick with calisthenics and see progress over a lifetime to truly appreciate lifting you have to remember we are dealing with torque and you can increase the demand on the muscle by changing the weight or the distance from the fulcrum and im not sure to what extent the muscle know the difference you definitely dont need weights to get big
